message: What python client do you use? Has anyone tried using eventlet's monkey patching with a python redis client?
I've used pyredis with gevent monkeypatch and it's wsgi server. I think it should work happily with eventlet too.
I use pyredis. Used it with both Stackless and greenlet and works well.
We use redisco but this is mainly prototype work. @dpwiz would love to hear more about gevent monkeypatching.
I've been using pyredis with Python 3.  I had to port it for that, but it didn't take too much work.
Just started experimenting with redis and redis-py this week.  I can't believe how awesome it is.  I want to personally thank the redis developers.
@dabeaz do you have a public repo for your port?
Convore is using Redis + eventlet for the live endpoint FWIW :-)
I want to learn Redis. Where can I find a serious guide to it?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of Redis compared to other NoSQL technologies?

@techieyuckyboy I like to think of Redis as adding the ability to create variables that other processes and servers can access.  Here's a great Redis tutorial, by @simonw http://simonwillison.net/static/2010/redis-tutorial/
